Vendor pack

A purchase-ready overview for evaluating Noetfield engagements: offers, named deliverables, security/privacy posture, and a clear invoice/PO onboarding path. Sensitive details are exchanged only after scope and a secure channel are agreed.

Public intake = non-confidential. Do not submit secrets, credentials, private keys, or regulated personal data. Secure sharing options are confirmed after kickoff. Reference: /vendor/ is a public vendor overview; purchasing starts from package intakes.

Offers (named deliverables)

Procurement-friendly summaries with deliverables, inputs, timeline rules, and scope drivers.

Copilot QuickScan

5–7 business days Decision-ready pack Base + fixed add-ons
Best for: rollout pressure

Fast Copilot governance and evidence outputs: posture, oversharing exposure paths, boundary recommendations, and connector controls.

  • Board-safe executive memo + practical next steps
  • Procurement-ready named deliverables
  • Email-first kickoff by default (scope call available if required)
Procurement snapshot
Deliverables • Inputs • Timeline rule • Scope drivers
⌄
Deliverables (named)
  • Executive Memo (PDF) — posture, risks, decision options
  • Exposure & Boundary Map (PDF) — oversharing paths + recommended boundaries
  • Control Checklist (XLSX/CSV) — prioritized controls + owners
  • Connector/Extension Notes (PDF) — tightening priorities
Inputs required (non-confidential)
  • Rollout intent (pilot vs broad)
  • High-level data types (e.g., HR, finance, client files)
  • Policy posture (basic / partial / mature)
Timeline rule
  • Clock starts after intake + scope confirmation
  • Default delivery window: 5–7 business days
Scope drivers
  • Single tenant vs multi-entity rollout
  • Number of business units in scope
  • Depth of connector/extension review
Invoice/PO: use Invoice / PO for onboarding steps.
Start Copilot QuickScan View details

Trust Brief (6-week)

6 weeks Governance plan Base + fixed add-ons
Best for: clarity + roadmap

A structured diagnostic that maps material AI use-cases, decision points, risks, and an initial operating model—ready for leadership review.

  • Defines owners, controls, and decision gates
  • Creates board-ready options and tradeoffs
  • Sets continuity into Trust Ledger
Procurement snapshot
Deliverables • Inputs • Timeline rule • Scope drivers
⌄
Deliverables (named)
  • Trust Brief Report (PDF) — decisions, risks, controls, roadmap
  • Use-Case Map (XLSX/CSV) — material use cases + owners
  • Decision Gate Set (PDF) — approvals, owners, rationale
  • Operating Model Draft (PDF) — roles, cadence, escalation
Inputs required (non-confidential)
  • High-level inventory of AI/tool usage
  • Owner groups (IT / legal / security)
  • Known constraints (regulatory, client, audit)
Timeline rule
  • Starts after intake + kickoff alignment
  • Default delivery window: 6 weeks
Scope drivers
  • Number of material use cases
  • Stakeholder groups involved
  • Need for memo variants
Invoice/PO: use Invoice / PO for onboarding steps.
Start Trust Brief View details

Trust Ledger

Ongoing Evidence continuity Monthly base + add-ons
Best for: audit readiness

A maintained register of AI systems, safeguards, sign-offs, and evidence—kept ready for recurring scrutiny (board, client, audit, regulator).

  • Repeatable exports and accountability mapping
  • Change-trail mindset (what changed, when, why)
  • Reduces “answer-later” scrambling
Procurement snapshot
Deliverables • Inputs • Timeline rule • Scope drivers
⌄
Deliverables (named)
  • Ledger Register (maintained) — systems, risks, controls, approvals
  • Board Export (PDF) — periodic summary + changes since last cycle
  • Evidence Index (CSV/XLSX) — evidence pointers + gaps
Inputs required (non-confidential)
  • High-level list of AI systems/tools
  • Accountable roles
  • Cadence preference (monthly/quarterly)
Timeline rule
  • Ongoing service; first cycle begins after kickoff
  • Exports delivered on agreed cadence
Scope drivers
  • Number of systems in scope
  • Export cadence + stakeholder set
  • Depth of evidence indexing
Output spec: see /trust-ledger/output.
Start Trust Ledger View details

Playbook Pro

One-time purchase Template kit Teams & agencies
Best for: templates first

A reusable governance kit for multi-client or multi-team work: intake → due diligence → incident patterns → client-ready briefs.

  • Designed to support procurement questionnaires
  • Reusable structure across engagements
  • Upgrade path into Trust Brief / Trust Ledger
Open Playbook Pro View Playbook
Procurement note: If internal approval requires a single file, publish a redacted vendor PDF at /vendor/vendor-pack.pdf and link it from the rail.

Security posture (public summary)

High-level answers suitable for initial vendor review. Detailed controls and evidence are scoped in the SOW/DPA phase.

Access model

Least-privilege and revocable access as required by scope. Data access is minimized and time-bounded where possible.

Evidence mindset

Deliverables are evidence-first: explicit assumptions, named artefacts, and traceable outputs suitable for leadership review.

Incident response

A defined response path is agreed per engagement. Contact is routed through procurement for onboarding, and escalations are confirmed at kickoff.

Security review depth

If an organisation requires deeper review (questionnaires, annexes, or control mapping), the work is handled under the engagement scope.

Related: Trust Ledger output spec → /trust-ledger/output. Product context → /app.

Privacy boundaries

Public intake is routing-only. Sensitive artefacts are exchanged only after scope and a secure channel are agreed.

Public intake

Non-confidential only. No secrets, credentials, private keys, or regulated personal data.

Data minimization

Default is to request only what is necessary for the deliverables, aligned to scope and buyer approvals.

Retention

Retention and deletion are set per engagement (SOW/DPA-scoped), aligned to organisational requirements.

Sub-processors

Sub-processors (if applicable) are disclosed in engagement documents and aligned to required contract terms.

Official policy page: /privacy. Additional governance policies: /policies.

Contracting path

A lightweight, purchase-ready path designed to reduce back-and-forth while staying compliant with organisational processes.

Commercial documents

Engagements are delivered under a scoped SOW. Contracting terms are confirmed per buyer requirements.

NDA / DPA

If required, NDA and DPA steps are handled during onboarding. Detailed terms are confirmed once scope and parties are established.

Kickoff format

Email-first by default to stay lightweight. A short call is available if scope confirmation requires it.

Timeline rule

Delivery clocks start after intake + scope confirmation, with named deliverables and clear assumptions.

Terms: /terms. Contact: /contact.
